go_terms.name: chloroplast thylakoid membrane
go_terms.definition: The portion of the thylakoid membrane surrounding the photosystem II complex in the chloroplast.

go_terms.name: photosystem II reaction center
go_terms.definition: A protein complex that contains the D1 and D2 core proteins of photosystem II.

go_terms.name: photosynthesis
go_terms.definition: The process by which a living organism captures light energy and uses it to drive the synthesis of organic compounds.

go_terms.name: detection of visible light
go_terms.definition: The series of events in which a visible light stimulus is received by a cell and converted into a molecular signal.

go_terms.name: red light signaling pathway
go_terms.definition: A series of molecular signals initiated by the detection of red light by a photoreceptor and resulting in the activation or repression of gene expression.

go_terms.name: protein homodimerization activity
go_terms.definition: Interacting selectively and non-covalently with an identical protein to form a homodimer.

go_terms.name: chloroplast thylakoid membrane
go_terms.definition: The portion of the thylakoid membrane surrounding the photosystem II complex in the chloroplast.

go_terms.name: photosynthesis
go_terms.definition: The process by which a living organism captures light energy and uses it to drive the synthesis of organic compounds.
